commit_list.message:
Ensure creation of files for all declaration types.

A file should be created for each declaration type, even if no declarations
of the given type exist in the headers -- future steps expect at least an empty
file to exist for each type.
commit_list.repo_description: Generates MRuby bindings from C Header files via libclang

commit_list.message:
Switched to use directory_watcher gem

The inotify gem doesn't seem to want to build on my system, and
I also noticed it's aged a bit.  When I was installing some other
gem the other day, I noticed it depended on directory_watcher,
and this seems worth a try.  Instead of looking for close_write,
directory_watcher finds files added, modified, or removed.

Changed git add command to use -A, to note any changes, adds and
removals.

Signed-off-by: Chris Riddoch <riddochc@gmail.com>

commit_list.message:
Workaround for IE8/9 bug and rack's session hijacking.

The way I'm using sessions, and testing for changes in IP address
myself and timeouts makes the built-in session hijacking less useful
than it otherwise would be.  Still, it's an unsettling bug.

Links about the issue:
* https://github.com/rkh/rack-protection/issues/11
* http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10102893/sinatra-app-using-omniauth-gets-rackprotectionsessionhijacking-in-ie9

Signed-off-by: Chris Riddoch <riddochc@gmail.com>

commit_list.message:
Fixes for touch events on mobile devices to jquery ui's drag-and-drop

Without this code, the touch events used by safari on the ipad don't
seem to translate to corresponding mouse events of clicking and
dragging.  Fortunately someone else has already solved this problem:

git://github.com/furf/jquery-ui-touch-punch.git

Signed-off-by: Chris Riddoch <riddochc@gmail.com>

commit_list.message:
Ruby changed Array#choice to Array#sample

Looks like Matz renamed this in ruby commit 9295fd4b5, almost exactly 8 years ago.
Running assert on itself, with a current ruby (tested with 2.2.3p147), shows 16 errors
resulting from the lack of a 'choice' method on Array.
